smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'SettingsActivity' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'AlertListFragment' with '29' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Interface 'View' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'
Class 'AlertListPresenter' with '16' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'NotificationsPresenter' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'NotificationsActivity' with '16' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
File 'Utils.kt' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'
Object 'Analytics' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'
Class 'BkkInfoClient' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class AlertListFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class BkkInfoClient is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface View is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function formatDate appears to be too complex.
The function parseRouteType appears to be too complex.
The function parseRouteColors appears to be too complex.
The function parseRouteType appears to be too complex.
The function numberPostfixHu appears to be too complex.

smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

instances.message: This method is overloaded too many times.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function parseAlert is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function parseAlertDetail is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function onResponseCallback is nested too deeply.

smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught

smells.name: FunctionParameterNaming
smells.description: Function parameter names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Function parameter names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Function parameter names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: EnumNaming
smells.description: Enum names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Enum entry names should match the pattern: ^[A-Z][_a-zA-Z0-9]*

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: android.preference.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.ofalvai.bpinfo.util.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.ofalvai.bpinfo.util.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.android.volley.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: SerialVersionUIDInSerializableClass
smells.description: A class which implements the Serializable interface does not define a correct serialVersionUID field. The serialVersionUID field should be a constant long value inside a companion object.

instances.message: The class Alert implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.
The class Route implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.
